repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body: I think this should best point to the position of the last `=` sign, rather than the RHS node. That would make the error reporting more accurate and solve the problem at hand at the same time.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1542,10 +1544,15 @@ def p_expression_or_assignment(s):
         return Nodes.ExprStatNode(expr.pos, expr=expr)
 
     rhs = expr_list[-1]
+    if rhs is None:
+        assert s.fault_tolerant  # i.e.: This should never happen unless we're in fault-tolerant mode.
+        pos = s.position()
+    else:
+        pos = rhs.pos

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
            break  # Important for fault-tolerant mode (don't recurse forever).
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -946,9 +948,11 @@ def p_string_literal(s, kind_override=None):
             break
         elif sy == 'EOF':
             s.error("Unclosed string literal", pos=pos)
+            break  # Important for fault-tolerant mode (don't recurse forever).
         else:
             s.error("Unexpected token %r:%r in string literal" % (
                 sy, s.systring))
+            break # Important for fault-tolerant mode (don't recurse forever).

@@ -1539,9 +1545,23 @@ def p_expression_or_assignment(s):
                 rhs = p_testlist(s)
             return Nodes.InPlaceAssignmentNode(lhs.pos, operator=operator, lhs=lhs, rhs=rhs)
         expr = expr_list[0]
-        return Nodes.ExprStatNode(expr.pos, expr=expr)
+        if expr is None:
+            # i.e.: This should never happen unless we're in fault-tolerant mode.
+            # Change for an ellipsis so that other places expecting the expression
+            # work later on.
+            assert s.fault_tolerant
+            expr = ExprNodes.EllipsisNode(s.position())
+        else:
+            pos = expr.pos
+        return Nodes.ExprStatNode(expr, expr=expr)

comment_data.body: This should go next to the other attribute assignments from parameters above.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -342,6 +342,8 @@ def __init__(self, file, filename, parent_scanner=None,
         self.sy = ''
         self.next()
 
+        self.fault_tolerant = fault_tolerant

comment_data.body:
Since this is repeated (and might end up being repeated more often at some point), it seems worth a helper function.

BTW, what makes `expr` None here? I'm asking to find out if this is the right place to do the replacement, or if the functions that return the `None` here would be a better place.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1539,9 +1545,23 @@ def p_expression_or_assignment(s):
                 rhs = p_testlist(s)
             return Nodes.InPlaceAssignmentNode(lhs.pos, operator=operator, lhs=lhs, rhs=rhs)
         expr = expr_list[0]
-        return Nodes.ExprStatNode(expr.pos, expr=expr)
+        if expr is None:
+            # i.e.: This should never happen unless we're in fault-tolerant mode.
+            # Change for an ellipsis so that other places expecting the expression
+            # work later on.
+            assert s.fault_tolerant
+            expr = ExprNodes.EllipsisNode(s.position())
